properties.name: Boston, MA--Faneuil Hall Market
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger Faneuil Hall Market Pl, Boston, MA 02109Faneuil Hall Marketplace. For over 250 years, the marketplace has played an integral role in the life of Boston\'s residents. So if you are ready to see, taste and come to this historic and exciting place. Welcome to Faneuil Hall Marketplace.

properties.name: Boston, MA--The Harp Bar
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 85 Causeway Street, Boston, MA 02114 A sports and entertainment mecca for over ten years, The Harp is one of Boston\'s best singles and meeting spots, revving up crowds through-out the seasons. Two floors with three bars for after work drinks, latest in sports and live entertainment, Djs, Dancing and Boston\'s best Nightlife!

properties.name: Chicago, Illinois--Water Tower Place
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 835 N Michigan Ave ,Chicago, IL 60611Water Tower Place is a large urban, mixed-use development comprising a 758,000 sq ft shopping mall and 74 story skyscraper in Chicago, Illinois. The complex is located at 835 North Michigan Avenue, along the Magnificent Mile. It is named after the nearby Chicago Water Tower.

properties.name: Chicago,IL--Martini Park (Lounge&Live Music)
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  640 N La Salle Dr # 552,Chicago, IL 60654Martini Park is an unprecedented combination of warm hospitality, highly-acclaimed cuisine, signature martinis and cocktails, and world-class design. Featuring live contemporary music nightly, this cutting edge concept combines a vibrant atmosphere with warm and friendly service to provide an unforgettable restaurant and entertainment experience.

properties.name: Colorado,Denver--16th Street Mall
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 16th St., Denver, CO 80202The 16th Street Mall is Denver’s hub of shopping, dining and entertainment that stretches for 16 blocks in the heart of downtown. The 16th Street Mall recently became a wireless internet hot spot—visitors can log on for free anywhere along the Mall or Skyline Park. The mall is home to many of the most popular shops, including Virgin Records Megastore, Niketown and Gap. The Mall’s delicious restaurants, including Maggiano’s Little Italy, Hard Rock Cafe and Rock Bottom Brewery, are all excellent places to take a break from a hard day of shopping. Several smaller cafes can also be found along the street, including Paradise Bakery, Suzy Q’s Deli & Frozen Yogurt and Good Times. For a unique outdoor shopping experience, 16th Street Mall is the perfect choice while visiting Denver.

properties.name: Colorado,Denver--Club Vinyl
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 1082 Broadway, Denver, COVinyl has long been one of Denver\'s hot-spots: consisting of three floors with a Grecian inspired rooftop patio. The main floor of Vinyl has two bars and a spacious dance floor. Also located on the main floor is a luxurious nook with five large beds perfect for lounging and listening to great music. For a high energy engagement the basement room at Vinyl offers flat-screen televisions above all the seating areas. Vinyl is host to the biggest and best DJ\'s in the business today, both international and local!!!

properties.name: Colorado,Denver--Funky Buddha Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 776 Lincoln St, Denver, CO 80203Trendy scenesters of the decidedly beautiful and moneyed set flock to the Funky Buddha Lounge in Denver to get their pricey booze, velvet roped playtime in. This hip and happening Denver bar hotspot features local artwork adorning the walls incase you needed eye candy other than the abundant human variety, some of Denver\'s slickest DJs spinning house, trance and hip-hop and an upstairs patio with some kickin\' bartenders that throw down the libation gauntlet nightly. You\'d do well to arrive at the Funky Buddha Lounge early if you\'re planning a night of Denver bar drinking and leave your usual dress sweats baseball cap clothes combo at home lest you be left out in the cold with the unwashed masses.

properties.name: Florida, (SouthBeach) Miami--Club Nikki
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger Your first view of Club Nikki (formerly Pearl) will leave you speechless. Entering the club’s main room just above Nikki Beach you are surrounded by voluminous waves of fur-lined curtains and soon become totally engulfed an orange neon glow. Created by French designer Stephane Dupoux, whose credits include Opium, Café Tabac, Touch, Nikki Beach Club, The Living Room, and The Strand, Pearl has a vibe all its own, with an off-beat DJ playlist to complement the sensually retro design. New romantic and electronica fill the air as Club Nikki’s guests bask in an eerie light reminiscent of 2001: A Space Odyssey. The brilliant, orange glow illuminates the ocean-front venue and accents the lounge\'s fur walls and white fur-lined curtains. What results is a beautiful space that invokes a futuristic, yet retro feel. Even the uniforms, designed by Lubna Zawawi, accentuate the chic surroundings.

properties.name: Florida, (SouthBeach) Miami--Nikki Beach
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger     1 Ocean Drive,Miami Beach, FL Nikki Beach\'s Sunday afternoon beach soirees are as infamous as South Beach nightlife itself. Here, you\'ll find dedicated nightlife impresarios, models, playboys and jet setters worshipping the nightlife during the day. This sexy Saint Tropez-style club is where South Beach\'s most beautiful people gather not on the seventh day of the week, but nearly every other evening as well. With chic surroundings, teepees, hammocks and flowing champagne, Nikki Beach quickly gained a reputation as a heavenly paradise on earth. The open-air atmosphere, retro \'80s music, deep house tunes and delicious dishes may be why this is one of the most publicized destinations in South Florida.

properties.name: Florida, Miami(Coconut Grove)--Mr. Moe's
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  3131 Commodore Plz, Coconut Grove, FL 33133A log cabin, grizzly bears and live music in Miami? A strange combination, but you can find it all at Mr. Moe’s. This unique Miami club boasts a selection of Americana items and a decidedly rustic, down-home feel. With its flat-screen TVs, 95-foot bar, wide selection of beers and ciders and full dining menu, this Miami sports bar is the perfect place to watch the game. A mechanical bull, pool table and arcade games add to the fun.

properties.name: Florida,(South Beach)Miami--Lincoln Road
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger          Lincoln Road Miami Beach, FL Lincoln Road is an open-air pedestrian mall, considered South Beach\'s premiere shopping area. It is home to many restaurants and several night clubs, such as Score and Funktion, as well as many retail outlets. While Lincoln Road was one time rather downtrodden, with its unique boutique shops and restaurants, since the 1960s it has had "an esoteric chic that maintains its trendy appeal." (ref. Ocean Drive Magazine) It is located in between 16th Street and 17th Street and spans the beach in an east-west direction.

properties.name: Florida,Miami(Coconut Grove)--Senor Frogs
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  3480 Main Highway, Coconut Grove, FL 33133Señor Frog’s is a Mexican-theme franchised "infamous party scene" bar and grill in tourist destinations throughout Mexico, the Caribbean, South America, and the United States. "You go to Señor Frog’s when you\'re on vacation, if you want to get crazy and nobody knows you " is what a local manager says.

properties.name: Goergia, Atlanta--Lennox Square Mall
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger       3393 Peachtree Road NE, Atlanta, GA 30326Lenox Square is the Southeast\'s premier shopping destination. Lenox Square is anchored by Bloomingdale\'s, Neiman Marcus and Macy\'s, and features nearly 250 specialty stores - shops like Anthropologie, BCBG, Bobby Jones, Burberry, Brooks Brothers, Calvin Klein, Cartier, David Yurman, Louis Vuitton, Kate Spade, Kiehl\'s Since 1851, Ralph Lauren, Salvatore Ferragamo, Shabby Chic, St. John, and Zara.

properties.name: Goergia,(midtown) Atlanta--Lava Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 57 13th St NE, Atlanta, GA 30309A night scene trifecta in the truest sense, this multi-level building houses one of the trendiest nightclubs in Atlanta, a suave lava-surfaced bar and a cozy South Beach-style lounge area. The dance floor, located on the lower level, vibrates to the latest house and industrial beats. Between songs, the young and the beautiful alike line up at the crescent-shaped lava bar to sample what many believe are Midtown\'s best martinis. Meanwhile, the tony lounge, highlighted by indigo and saffron accents, entices patrons to relax amid velvet couches and a warm fireplace. Lava\'s 20-something scene often spills onto its candlelit patio, shared with sister nightspot Cosmo.

properties.name: Memphis,TN--Beale Street
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 203 Beale St., Ste. 300, Memphis, TN 38103The music and entertainment pulse of downtown Memphis, Legendary greats such as W.C. Handy, B.B. King, Rufus Thomas, Willie Mitchell and Isaac Hayes have showcased their talents on Beale. Beale Street offers three blocks of night clubs, specialty shops, galleries and restaurants.

properties.name: Missourri/Kansas City--Power and Light District
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger    1100 Walnut St # 3000,Kansas City, MO‎ -The Kansas City Power & Light District or Power & Light District is a shopping and entertainment district. The 50 million mixed-use district is one of the largest development projects in the Midwestern United States[2] The Power & Light District is one of only a few places in the United States where possession and consumption of open containers of alcoholic beverages are allowed on the street, although they remain prohibited on the street throughout the rest of Kansas City.

properties.name: Texas, (Downtown) Dallas--Mantus Dance Club
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 1520 Main St,Dallas, TX 75201The Dallas Club Scene is much like of Miami (South-Beach) Clubs come and go like the seasons, however, there is one club that still remains-- it\'s Mantus. Mantus on Fri-Sat. are nice. It\'s the best Sunday Spot around.

properties.name: Texas, (Uptown) Dallas--Corner Bar and Grill
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  4830 Mckinney Ave,Dallas, TX 75205If you\'re looking for a genuinely down to earth, no-nonsense bar with great food and even better drinks, then consider The Corner Bar & Grill.

properties.name: Texas, (Uptown) Dallas--Lotus Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 2900 McKinney Ave. Dallas, Tx.Lotus\'s winning features include the seductive, Balinese-furnished patio in a city that\'s mad for patios, space to roam around a central stand-up rail and bottle-service banquettes done in earth tones and accented with candles. Great Thurs-Saturdays !

properties.name: Texas, Austin (4th St)--Six Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 117 W 4th St,Austin, TX 78701Six Lounge is owned by the greatest cyclist, Lance Armstrong. Good atmosphere inside, with a balcony overlooking the bottom floor. You can also go up to the roof where there\'s a second bar and watch the people on 5th street. They make great cocktails, and appetizers - especially during happy hour.

properties.name: Texas, Austin (Lamar)---Whole Foods Market
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  801 East Lamar Austin, TXThis is the mother of all Whole Foods. There are at least two coffee stands, a sushi stand, a nut stand, a chocolate stands, a coffee island, it\'s a whole city block, the size of a Wal-Mart in there. Everything is neat and attractive, very clean. My favorite part is the walk through beer cooler with a great variety of American and Canadian micro brews. There\'s an outdoor seating area on the roof-top and right out-side to enjoy your food.

properties.name: Texas, Dallas-- North Park Mall
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger        8687 N. Central Expressway,Dallas, Texas 75225 NorthPark Center is an upscale shopping mall located in Dallas, Texas. The center has over 235 stores and restaurants. With over 25 million visitors annually, NorthPark Center has consistently been named the top attraction in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex by the Dallas Business Journal, keeping NorthPark\'s anchors at the top in sales volume.

properties.name: Texas, Houston (midtown)--Red Door Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 2416 Brazos St,Houston, TX 77006A spacious floor plan and circular bar make it easy to navigate the often-crowded downstairs. A staircase on the left leads upstairs to the penthouse-like patio, where stone benches and an awe-inspiring view of downtown await. An unprecedented word-of-mouth campaign has made this bar the place to be. The atmosphere is electric, and the crowd, which fashions itself as a new urban elite, will keep model scouts busy for months. The DJs eschew typical garage-house lounge fare and reach deep into their crates for cheesy yet memorable songs from the \'80s.

properties.name: Texas, Houston--The Drake Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger 1902 Washington Avenue. Houston, TX 77007The Drake is a luxurious cocktail lounge located just off bustling Washington Avenue. The two-story, 7,000 square-foot former warehouse space has the vibe of a high-end club with the intimate feel of a sexy speakeasy, encompassing exposed brick, warm candlelight, elegant chandeliers, luxe leather banquettes and rich fabrics throughout.

properties.name: Texas,(Uptown) Dallas--Idle Rich Pub
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  2614 McKinney Ave,Dallas, TX 75204Think of Cheers! I\'m a big fan of going to Idle Rich because I consider it "Uptown for Beginner\'s." It\'s the place you take a friend who thinks that Uptown is full of hoity toity places that demand you pay bottle service and listen to shady house music in an poorly designed modern atmosphere. It\'s big, it\'s dark and it\'s always packed but never too bad to get a drink. . .factor in the people watching and you\'ve got yourself a pretty good night.

properties.name: Texas--Houston, The Galleria Mall
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger          Ste 4800,5085 Westheimer Rd, Houston, TX 77056The Galleria is an upscale mixed-use urban development centrally located in the Uptown District of Houston, Texas. With 3 million total square feet of space that includes 2.4 million of gross leasable area with over 375 stores, the Galleria is the largest mall in Texas and seventh-largest in the United States. With 26 million annual visitors.

properties.name: Texas. Houston (midtown)--Pub Fiction (Pub Bar)
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger  2303 Smith St,Houston, TX 77006Many Attractive People. Good music. Great for mixing and mingling or getting a table with some friends. Music not so overwhelmingly loud that it\'s impossible to talk, which is great and often hard to find. Easy to walk around and talk to people. Good service at the bar. The back one is easier to get drinks from, but the front one isn\'t so bad that it isn\'t worth rubbing elbows with some cute strangers. Drinks were average price. Valet parking for . Sometimes there\'s a long line at the door, but it\'s not as bad as some places

properties.name: Texas/Uptown Dallas--Quarter Bar
properties.description: Posted by Timmyswagger   3301 McKinney Avenue, Dallas, 75204 The Quarter Bar is located in one of the most popular locations in the Uptown area that draws young professionals almost every night of the week. The Quarter is a 2 story restaurant and bar that includes an excellent patio and several rooms to lounge in. Beware, the bartending staff is not shy to pour stiff drinks as we found each one tasting above par and right on the money. Although the crowd at the Quarter can get tight during peak times, the Quarter is usually a great starter for excellent people watching and pre-drinks
